General Assistant Job at May Publishing Limited




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

May Publishing Limited is a research, knowledge management and publishing firm, which has continued to pursue remarkable heights in the production, management and preservation of knowledge, in scholarly and strategic research and publishing, and in the development of high standards in literacy and learning through general interest works. With its excellent research-oriented publications and professionally articulated compendiums of biographies, autobiographies, corporate histories, and scholarly literatures, it has been distinguished for and committed to the digital documentation of knowledge and information that are essential to the high value-orientation and development of society. Through its cutting-edge research, professional editorial processes, and unique methods of harnessing and producing audience-compelling narratives, the firm has been assigned world-class projects from top-class individuals, corporate entities, and other states institutions, the depth of which has been attested by readers as appealing, engaging and significant to human, social and corporate development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Assistant
Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a reliable and organized General Assistant to provide all-round support within our growing digital media company.
	This role includes a mix of office tasks and occasional domestic assistance to the Managing Director.
	The ideal candidate should be trustworthy, proactive, computer literate, and ready to take initiative as needed.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide administrative support including handling correspondence, scheduling, and basic documentation.
	Assist with day-to-day office operations and errands.
	Support domestic tasks for the MD as required (e.g.organizing, shopping).
	Maintain cleanliness and order in work and assigned domestic areas.
	Help with basic data entry and use of email, Word documents, and spreadsheets.
	Run personal and official errands as directed.


Requirements


	Minimum of S.S.C.E qualification (Bachelor's Degree is a plus).
	Good spoken and written communication skills.
	Basic computer literacy (Microsoft Word, Excel, email, internet use).
	Must be trustworthy, discreet, and dependable.
	Ability to multitask and work with minimal supervision.
	Good personal hygiene and respectful demeanor.
	Proximity to the job location in Lagos is an added advantage.


Preferred:


	Prior experience in administrative assistant roles.
	Familiarity with supporting domestic/home-related tasks.


Remuneration
Competitive and based on experience.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to:
The General Manager,
May Publishing Limited,
14B, Adenike Ogunye, Magodo,
Lagos State.

Graphics Designer Job at Owens and Xley Consults




        
    

        
        Owens and Xley is a Small Business Advisory and Consulting Company in Lagos, Nigeria. Our services include of Small Business Startup and Set up, Business Plan preparation, Business Process Design and Business Strategy Formulation.

We know the role good planning plays in any business and its associated costs; and the initial capital challenges faced by a small business which is why we have developed solutions which ensure that small business owners have access to technical skills but at a fraction of the cost.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	In this role, you’ll be play a visual role in shaping the visual identity of the brand across all platform.
	You’ll ensure that every visual touchpoint consistently reflects the brand’s aesthetic and values.
	You’ll be a visual storyteller who understand how to communicate fashion, emotion, and brand identity through imagery and layouts.


Responsibilities


	Develop and execute visual concepts for campaigns, collections, and brand storytelling.
	Lead the development of all visual assets across digital, print, and packaging.
	Design campaign materials, brand presentations, and in-store graphics.
	Prepare production-ready files for print and digital use, ensuring quality and accuracy.
	Research and stay updated on design trends, relevant to culture, fashion, and branding.
	Contribute to ideation and development of brand storytelling through design.
	Guide and mentor junior designers and freelance creatives.
	Translate complex creative briefs into compelling visuals concepts.
	Develop and maintain a consistent visual identity across all social platforms.
	Create graphics for social media, and e-commerce in alignment with seasonal campaigns.
	Review and refine designs based on feedbacks from cross-functional teams.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field.
	4+ years of professional design experience, preferably in fashion or lifestyle brand
	Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator)
	A strong and relevant portfolio that showcase branding, and layouts.
	Understanding pf printing techniques and digital production requirements.
	Exceptional attention to detail and strong aesthetic sense.
	Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
	A collaborative mindset and strong communication skill


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@owensxley.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Customer Success Executive Job at Moove




        
    

        
        Moove is on a mission to redefine what large-scale rideshare leasing and vehicle ownership look like in Africa. We are developing an innovative model to rapidly improve the availability of vehicles for on-demand ridesharing services across major metro cities while also creating sustainable jobs for drivers

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Success Executive 

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Operations

About the Role
     

            
    




	As a Customer Success Executive at Moove, you will play a key role in ensuring our clients' satisfaction and success. Your responsibilities will include building strong relationships with customers, understanding their needs, and proactively addressing any issues or concerns.
	You will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver solutions, provide product insights, and contribute to the overall growth of client accounts.
	This role offers an exciting opportunity to foster client engagement, promote retention, and contribute to the continuous improvement of Moove's products and services.


What You’ll be Doing


	Monitoring drivers’ performance.
	Conducting daily check-in on drivers’ pulse.
	Supporting drivers.
	Solving driver's issues while drivers are in transit.
	Receiving inbound calls from drivers.
	Making outbound calls to drivers.
	Conducting driver survey.
	Compiling data from drivers survey
	Accountability of all Moove vehicles
	Ensuring that drivers obey rules and regulations as laid down by the company.
	Ensuring that drivers get the right information from the company.


Who You'll Be Working with:


	Directly reporting to our Customer Success Manager, and closely working with our Operations Team.


Key Metrics


	Daily retention targets as % of return walkins
	Weekly churn targets
	Daily Ticket resolutions for DPs basis physical and remote interactions
	Daily Driver performance basis supply hour and trip targets of the city
	Daily helping DPs increase earnings if SH is at optimal level, monitored via week on week DP earnings
	Overall DP portfolio monitoring basis allocated count of DPs


Requirements
What You will need for this position:


	Candidates should possess a Degree in any discipline.
	2-years of experience in customer care/support roles.
	Experience in the transportation industry is an added advantage.
	Proficient in the use of Microsoft Suites (Excel).
	Ability to manage people.
	The candidate must possess an eye for details.
